ResponsesInList.Title: Possibility to let students confirm their appointment made in scheduler?
ResponsesInList.Text:
We use the scheduler activity for students to be able to book a timeslot for a company visit. We publisch the scheduler a few weeks ahead of the actual visit and registration is on first-come-first-served basis. Regularly student drop out of the program, even though the have registered for a company visit in the future. Can we set up the scheduler activity to send not only a reminder mail one week in advance, but to als show a button in that mail (or in the scheduler activity on Moodle) that students need to click to reconfirm their intent to show up? And if they do not reconfirm by 48 hours in advance, the timeslot of the non-responders tot the confirmation mail need to be released so that others have the chance to attend. How could this be achieved on Moodle (even if with another activity than the scheduler, I would be happy to hear it).

We now have a very labor-intensive workaround that we have to maintain for quite a lot of schedulers (we have a lot of company visits) and we need to improve this process: 1 - When the scheduler is first published, the completion status of that activity cannot be manipulated by a student 2 - One week i advance, the reminder mail is sent out. We cannot choose the teckt of that mail 3 - On the same day, the teacher sets the completion status so that it must be set manually by a student. 4 - The teacher then also checks who is registered and sends all these students an e-mail asking them to set the completion status of the correct scheduler activity to "completed" 5 - 48 hours in advance, the teacher does a cross check between who is registered and who has set the completion status to "completed". 6 - All registered students that have not set the completion status are deemed as unconfirmed and their registration is removed so that others have the chance to register and attend 7 - An e-mail to all students who could not register is sent out that new places have opened up.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler across site or multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Hillel, The solution I've found is to use a meta course and place the scheduler there. Inês

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler across site or multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: I agree that using a metacourse is the best option. Just to note that the issue is raised once in a while, but it's really related to Moodle's core architecture, not Scheduler itself. To be specific, Scheduler is an "activity module" in Moodle parlance (like Assignment, Glossary, Quiz and others) , and instances of activities need to be tied to a course. Hence every Scheduler needs to be attached to a course (or perhaps the front page , which is also a kind of course). Users need to be enrolled in that course in order to make a booking.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students cannot book appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you, Przemek Kaszubski, for your reply. However, I am not sure I fully understand your answer. The groups I mentioned are student groups, which are created by themselves, and represent a set of students that work together in the course. They submit works together, as a group, and through out the course they interact with each other to accomplish the course’s tasks. I guess this organization (sets of students that work in group) is pretty common in many courses (either supported by a platform like Moodle or without any platform). So, what would be the logic of adding a teacher to a group of students? Or, for that matter, adding a teacher to all groups of students in a course? Please don’t take me wrong. I truly believe that your solution works for the Scheduler plugin. I am just trying to understand its logic, as I have this feeling that I am missing something (maybe the ideia I had about groups is just wrong). Best regards, Miguel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students cannot book appointments
ResponsesInList.Text: Groups in a Moodle course can be set up for different purposes, whether course groups or task groups or some other ad-hoc groups, and anyone can be a member of multiple groups etc. Not sure which version of Moodle you're using, too, but group management is becoming an increasingly more important feature (also because of privacy issues). If the mode for an activity is a group mode (separate or visible) and not "No groups", and no teacher or non-editing teacher is added to the group, then there is no one of an upper rank in that group directly assigned to book an appointment with (or to be graded by, as in assignments, or to respond to the group's forum discussions etc). Yes, a general course teacher ("editing teacher") can do many things, but that is because editing teachers act also like managers or moderators in the entire course (with access to all groups defined in that course). S/he can thus step in anywhere and do whatever. If there are groups in a course, and you're not in them, these are dubbed as "groups" simply (or "Other groups"), but not "My groups". For those groups that do not need a grader, a TA, or other dedicated "contact" , you might not have to add a teacher (or non-editing teacher), but for those groups that collaborate and submit things that are supposed to be graded or monitored by a teacher, that teacher should be specified - otherwise communications will often fail - forum subscriptions, assignment notifications, and also scheduler appointments. If you had 5 teachers sharing a course and teaching 5 different groups, you wouldn't want to have each of the teachers tracking all of the students all of the time, just the group they are actually teaching. Ergo - if you have at least one activity in your course that applies a separate groups or visible groups mode, then including the dedicated teacher(s) in each such group is at the very least recommended practice.

ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Przemek Kaszubski: Thank you very much for your thoughtful response. I really appreciate your help in this subject. In fact, as you pointed out, the concept of "groups" in Moodle goes far beyond simple “task-groups”. And I was missing its greater scope. As you guessed, my case is characterized by: 1) My course groups are "task-groups" and I'm the only teacher in the course. 2) These "task-groups" are the only groups in the course, and I would prefer not to add myself to each of them. So, I'll try your suggestions, hopping they accomplish want I intend with the Scheduler, which seemed to me pretty trivial: just set up a pool of slots that students could book, in a per group (a "task-group") basis, to meet me. Again, many thanks for your help (and for your time!). Best regards, Miguel

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle deletes appointments and sheduler before slots end
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello the way that Scheduler behaves is as follows: a slot is bookable only until its start time (or in fact a certain time before that, if so configured). If the start time is in the past and the slot is empty (ie no student has booked it), it will be deleted. You can disable the automatic deletion, though, by disabling the "Purge unused slots in the past" task via Moodle's admin menu.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: And suddenly, a missing slot
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm writing to report that my team has encountered a similar bug to the above. 8 slots that we set up have seemingly spontaneously disappeared. A team member reported to me that some slots they set up appear to be missing. I then looked at the activity logs and database and was able to assemble a list of 8 slot IDs for which I can see logged events pertaining to their creation, no logged events pertaining to their deletion, and that do not appear in the site database. We'd like to know if there's any info on whether this is a known issue, what its cause might be, and how we can prevent it happening in the future.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: And suddenly, a missing slot
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I can't really trace what has happened in your installation, but I can confirm that (a) not all operations on slots are logged; (b) unused slots in the past are automatically purged. The latter can be disabled, if you like, by disabling the corresponding task in the "Scheduled tasks" admin view. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: And suddenly, a missing slot
ResponsesInList.Text: We had an instructor report disappearing slots, too. We're not positive but we did notice that it's possible to create slots that are in the past (using recurring slots, the UI defaults to starting from the present day but lets you select hours in the past) which are subsequently deleted by the "purge unused slots" scheduled task. That task runs frequently, every 5 minutes by default I believe, so it appears like the slots you just created disappeared in front of your eyes.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: And suddenly, a missing slot
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm updating my post since we've been digging around in the log database after several tests. We discovered that if you are a teacher, you can perform the following tasks without the logs being visible in the database: - add a student to a slot - delete a student for a specific slot - revoke all students in a slot We think this might explain some of the apparent bugs described in this discussion. For example, if you (mistakenly) revoke all students, then the slot becomes unused and is purged. We can't prove this, but it could be an explanation in our case. We don't understand how it is possible to have no logs with such actions?

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler for Moodle 4.x
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users I have been quiet for some time on a release of Scheduler for Moodle 4.0 and beyond, mostly due to lack of available time. However, the master branch of Scheduler (on github) has over time been supplied with Moodle 4.x specific fixes, and should meanwhile be working fine (or at least without limitations that occurred in earlier versions of Moodle as well). Thanks to everyone who contributed fixes or reported issues on the Moodle Tracker . Behat tests indicate that Scheduler is now compatible with the latest Moodle 4.2 as well. I am therefore planning to (finally!) release a new 4.x version of Scheduler to the plugins DB in two weeks from now, that is, around mid-May. If anyone notices any 4.x-specific issues before then, please do report them to the Tracker and I will try to fix them before the release. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Making booking slots only visible to people in defined group
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm afraid that slots are always assigned to teachers (and students), not to groups, hence there's no way to restrict them to only one group in Scheduler, apart from restricting the entire activity to a group. However, depending on your situation, it might be useful to divide your groups into groupings , and restrict activities to groupings.

ResponsesInList.Title: Sharing the availability hours

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sharing the availability hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Scheduler will prevent teachers from making conflicting slots in different schedulers/courses - at least it will try hard to. Try doing this and you should see a "scheduling conflict" message.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sharing the availability hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks you. Could a teacher create availability slots and use the same on different courses, instead of creating different availability slots for each course? Thanks again!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sharing the availability hours
ResponsesInList.Text: Unfortunately not; Scheduler is designed as an "activity module" in Moodle terminology, and that means that its data needs to be attached to individual courses (in fact individual instances of Scheduler in a course). If you want teachers to offer slots to students across different courses, I usually recommend to create a " meta course ", i.e., one in which all students are enrolled, and create the Scheduler there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Settings for students to Add slots and Book them?
ResponsesInList.Text: In case it's still helpful after this long time: You can give anyone you like the capability to add slots (see https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Scheduler_Module_capabilities ). ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slots shown in Calendar
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Beatriz, the calendar events are "user events" i.e. they are attached to individual users, not the course. Hence I don't think it's possible to show all of those in a course. You would need to go to the scheduler instance itself to see a list of all slots (the "Overview" screen in Scheduler might also be of help, although I'm not sure whether it meets your needs). Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler and Moodle 3.11
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all I, understandably, had a number of inquiries regarding a version of Scheduler for Moodle 3.11, and the current version was tagged as compatible only with Moodle 3.9. Not least because we are migrating our own site to Moodle 3.11 soon, i had a look at the plugin now. As far as I'm aware, the latest release (i.e. 3.7.0) of Scheduler works with Moodle 3.10 and 3.11 as well, up to the following caveats: In Moodle 3.11, with debug messages switched on, you will see some warning messages about a deprecated API (user_picture::fields). These are warning messages only, and can be ignored. (They are fixed on the master branch but not on the MOODLE_37_STABLE branch, as this would make it incompatible with versions before 3.11.) Not all of the automated tests will work (this is always a challenge between Moodle releases); but as far as I can see, the underlying features do work. I have therefore marked Scheduler 3.7.0 as compatible with Moodle 3.10 and 3.11 in the plugins DB. If you find issues with Scheduler in those versions, please do file an issue on the Moodle Tracker , describing details. This is still not a major release of scheduler and has no added features (and some bugs like CONTRIB-8013 are still open). Thanks to everyone who filed bug reports or pull requests; they are not forgotten, even if I haven't gotten round to look at them. I still hope to get to that point soon, but the pandemic has put these plans on hold for some time. The major release will certainly be a 4.x release (with x=0 or x=1 being likely). Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler and Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users I have now marked the latest release of Scheduler (3.7.0) as compatible with Moodle 3.9 in the Plugins directory. This is not a new release - it's just to confirm that, according to my tests so far, Scheduler works on Moodle 3.9 just as well as on 3.7 and 3.8. If you saw any imcompatibilities, please report them here or on the Moodle Tracker . I'm still hoping to release a new version with bug fixes and (hopefully) added features later this year, but it will probably be more towards the end of the summer. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler and Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am fairly new to Moodle and I am trying to figure out how to use the scheduler extension. I have downloaded the zip file but now not sure how to actually access /use it. I apologize if my question doesn't belong here, just trying to navigate my way around. Kind regards, Sandra

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler and Moodle 3.9
ResponsesInList.Text: You need to unpack the ZIP file's contents into the directory "mod" within your Moodle installation (so that a directory "mod/scheduler" is created). Then, open (your Moodle URL )/admin/index.php in your browser. This is the same for all Moodle plugins - see here: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Installing_plugins#Installing_manually_at_the_server (NB there are other possible methods of installation, as mentioned on the page above.) Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Some doubts about the notifications system
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I've read the Docs page about the Scheduler and it's very clear but I'd like to confirm if I understood the notification functionalities correctly. I cannot check it by myself because, for policy and security reasons, the email notifications are disabled at my site by now. Here are my assumptions: When a teacher declines (i.e. "revokes") an appointment, only the students who had registered for that specific appointment are notified. When a slot is deleted, no one gets notified. An invitation is sent, by default, to all the participants of the course and not to the students who registered for that slot. To do that, a teacher should select them manually. Could you confirm or correct my assumptions? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some doubts about the notifications system
ResponsesInList.Text:
When
a teacher declines (i.e. "revokes") an appointment, only the students
who had registered for that specific appointment are notified. When a slot is deleted, no one gets notified. These two are correct. An
invitation is sent, by default, to all the participants of the course
and not to the students who registered for that slot. To do that, a
teacher should select them manually. I think that is not quite correct: The invitation or reminder is sent to all students who *did not* yet book a slot. However, the teacher can deselect some of them manually if wanted.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Some doubts about the notifications system
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Henning, your explanations are very helpful!

ResponsesInList.Title: Same teacher teaching different courses wanting to use the same office hours across each of his/her courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Friends, Please tell me this is possible! The plugin is kind of useless if I am a teacher with 5 courses, and I want to schedule the same office hours across these courses. Metalinking courses is a bad option for us, as it creates confusion with students by adding yet another course to their list of courses. If a student has 6 courses and sees 6 new meta-courses, it is a recipe for trouble. As a start to making this happen: Can you adapt the plugin where when the teacher sets up a Scheduler activity, that the teacher gets the option - that while creating it in one class - have by default set so that the particular scheduled activity is available for ANYONE with the student role in Moodle? It's not a final option, but it would at least solve the interim problem of having to create metacourses. A future iteration would then include giving the teacher a dropdown list where they could select particular courses for which he/she wants to share the same scheduled activity. What do you think? Paul

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Same teacher teaching different courses wanting to use the same office hours across each of his/her courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Paul Scheduler is (in Moodle parlance) an "activity module" and activities are linked to individual courses. There's no way around this - this is the way Moodle is designed to work. You could use one metacourse where *every* student in your system is enrolled, then you could set up a Scheduler there. Alternatively you might try to add a Scheduler to your Moodle front page , but I must say that this is poorly tested and probably needs some advanced configuration on your side. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Guests can't do anything here.
ResponsesInList.Text: I always get "Guests can't do anything here.", no matter if I put the Scheduler on the front page or part of a course, no matter if I assign teacher and student roles to the Scheduler activity or not. When adding a new Scheduler, it immediately shows "Guests can't do anything here." after I click "Save and display". Is this a bug, or have I missed something? I'm on Moodle 3.8 with Scheduler 3.7.0.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Guests can't do anything here.
ResponsesInList.Text: This error occurs if you don't have the relevant capabilities in the Scheduler activity. In order to see the "teacher side" of the activity, you need to have mod/scheduler:manage or mod/scheduler:attend; in order to see the "student side", you need mod/scheduler:appoint . See here for details: https://docs.moodle.org/39/en/Scheduler_Module_capabilities (In a standard setup, teachers, students and administrators will have the correct capabilities assigned automatically via their roles, but it may be that you are using customized roles which would need to be updated manually.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Does Scheduler work across more than 1 course?
ResponsesInList.Text: We want to use the Scheduler plug-in to register students from more than 1 course at a time for the same webinar. For example, we want students from Course #1, #2, and #3 to be able to use the scheduler to register together in the same webinar. We want to allow a maximum of 20 reservations for the webinar, so we want the Scheduler to keep track of the total registrations from the multiple courses and stop accepting registrations when it reaches 20. For example, if 10 students from Course #1 and 8 students from Course #2 register, and 2 students from Course #3 register, then the Scheduler will stop accepting reservations. Is this possible?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does Scheduler work across more than 1 course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi David, I'd do the following: In one of the courses, I create a hidden section in one of the affected courses and add the scheduler with the availability "Available but not visible to students". Then, in all the courses that need a registration in this specific slot, I create a label with a link to the activity, so that all students are redirected to that scheduler. Cheers!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Does Scheduler work across more than 1 course?
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to add to what Beatriz already said - Scheduler is an activity module and as such can reside in one course only. You'd need a "metacourse" in which all relevant students are enrolled, and then create the Scheduler there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Conflict between "booking in groups" setting  and "Maximum number of sudents per slots"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, This might seem like a small problem, but it had me baffled for a while. I set up a scheduler for appointments with groups of students, thus using the "booking in groups" parameter. I created the slots, sent the invites. Students came back to me saying that they couldn't book a time slot (not enough place available in the slot, or something to that effect). It took me a while to realize that this is because of the default "maximum number of students per slot" parameter set at "1" by default in the slot creation parameters. So although one student makes the appointment, you need enough "space" in the slot to accomodate all of the students in the group. This is not intuitive (at least for me). A quick solution could be to add that information in the "max number of student per slot"" parameter help bubble, i,e, something to the effect that if you do group  bookings, this parameter should disabled the parameter, or set it to number of students in your biggest groups. Thanks! Best, Eric

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler 3.7.0 released
ResponsesInList.Text:
Dear Scheduler users I have just released Scheduler 3.7.0 on the plugins DB. This release works for Moodle 3.7 and 3.8. Apart from bug fixes and some refactored code, below are the new and changed features. If you are using Scheduler with several teachers in one course, you will in particular want to have a look at the changed permissions model on the teacher side. There is now basic support for the completion API (when using grades) IMPORTANT: Permissions on the teacher side have changed. In particular: Teachers now strictly need the capability
'canseeotherteachersbooking' (or 'manageallappointments') in order to
see the "All appointments" tab. There are new capabilities 'editallgrades', 'editallnotes', and
'editallattended' which allow users without the 'manageallappointments'
capability to edit the grades, the teacher notes, or the attended flag
in all appointments of all teachers, in the appointment screen only. The configuration setting 'allteachersgrading' is no longer in use. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Get Scheduler calendaritems through API
ResponsesInList.Text: We are trying to get all calendaritems from a user with the API core_calendar_get_calendar_events function so we can send the calendaritems to our timetable application. The timetable application synchronizes with the Office365 calendar. When we use the core_calendar_get_calendar_events function we use the parameter courseid to get all the events. Problem is that we are not receiving the Scheduler calendar events with this function. We do get calendar events from other plugins such as Turnitin . Is this a bug or is this default behaviour? Is there another option to get the Schedular calendar events through another Moodle API call?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Get Scheduler calendaritems through API
ResponsesInList.Text: The reason may be that you are looking only for course events - the scheduler appointments are user events, however. Apart from that, they are just usual entires in the Moodle calendar.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Get Scheduler calendaritems through API
ResponsesInList.Text: Do you have any idea how we get these Scheduler user events through the API? We tried the following functions with parameters: Hierbij een aantal verschillende URL 's die we gebruikt hebben: Event by eventid: https://subdomain.domain.nl/webservice/rest/server.php?wstoken=&wsfunction=core_calendar_get_calendar_events&moodlewsrestformat=json&events [eventids][0]=1046 Event by courseid: https://subdomain.domain.nl/webservice/rest/server.php?wstoken=&wsfunction=core_calendar_get_calendar_events&moodlewsrestformat=json&events [courseids][0]=789 Event by categoryid: https://subdomain.domain.nl/webservice/rest/server.php?wstoken=&wsfunction=core_calendar_get_calendar_events&moodlewsrestformat=json&events [categoryids][0]=2&options[timestart]=1574208000

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Get Scheduler calendaritems through API
ResponsesInList.Text: The second one ("Event by courseid:") would do, I think. However, it seems that this returns user events only for the current user (the user that has logged in via the web service token). From a brief look at the code, it seems that that's what the web service is designed to do (the core webservice, not specifically Scheduler) . I didn't find any option to return user events for all users.

ResponsesInList.Title: Use  of parenthesis  in language file
ResponsesInList.Text: Somewhat of a technical   question but I was  wondering why  was there a  need  for parenthesis  in the string: $string['conflictremote'] = '{$a->datetime} ({$a->duration} minutes) in course {$a->courseshortname}, scheduler {$a->schedulername}'; Thanks, Dan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Use  of parenthesis  in language file
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan the parentheses ( ... ) are not for technical reasons, they are displayed as-is on the screen. The curly braces { ... } are for technical reasons, see https://docs.moodle.org/dev/String_API#Run-time_parameters . Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Reminder for teacher
ResponsesInList.Text: I would like to ask can the scheduler plugin send reminder to teacher as well? If not, any plan to add this feature into it? Thanks!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Reminder for teacher
ResponsesInList.Text: No, there are currently no reminder e-mails to teachers. I am also not convinced that they would be useful. In a typical scenario, teachers will have quite a number of consecutive time slots, hence a reminder e-mail for each slot (like for students) would not necessarily be helpful. Note that teacher's appointments appear in their Moodle calendar.

ResponsesInList.Title: Anonymous booking
ResponsesInList.Text: After a booking, Is it possible not to show the names of the students in the "students column"  ? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Anonymous booking
ResponsesInList.Text: No, Scheduler doesn't allow for anonymous bookings.

ResponsesInList.Title: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Henning, dear fellow Scheduler users, Since the last 8 days empty past slots have ceased to being deleted. What could be the cause and how can I fix that? Thank you for your answer, Sébastien

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Sebastien, these are deleted by a cronjob (or "scheduled task"). You can check on the Moodle admin pages whether the job has run. Maybe there's something blocking your cronjob?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: You're right, it was simply the cron not working. Thanks for your answer, Sébastien

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: Is there any way to set so past slots are not deleted?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Empty past slots not deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: You can disable the corresponding "Scheduled Task".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course creator's capabilities in Scheduler - needed?
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Przemek Course creators do, by default, have the same permissions in schedulers as editing teachers, only that they cannot "attend students", i.e., they are not supposed to be assigned to time slots. Of course, this is only the default setting. You can configure this to whatever suits you in your installation. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course creator's capabilities in Scheduler - needed?

I have never developed a plugin, am not a coder etc. etc. , but I was a bit surprised to see these mentioned capabilities set to Allow for a minor system role in the two plugins mentioned. So perhaps there are steps that can be taken to change the default to Nor set for Course creators in the future releases? Course creators after they create a course for themselves are automatically added as Teachers, so they will acquire everything they need at the course level. Many thanks for any possible concern. Best wishes, Przemek

ResponsesInList.Title: Link Competency with Scheduler activity ("Seen" state)
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it possible to do this? I added competencies to course and then to sheduler, but after mark student as Seen nothing happens in proficient of competencies of this student.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Link Competency with Scheduler activity ("Seen" state)
ResponsesInList.Text: Not really, currently. Competencies can be awarded on completion of an activity. However, Scheduler doesn't really define any custom completion events, beyond what works for any graded activity. You could, I think, achieve something similar as follows: set up a scheduler that has a grade scale (possibly just "competent/not competent"); configure the activity to be completed when the student receives a grade; and attach a competency to this completion event.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Error when trying to update a user profile field
ResponsesInList.Text: These are really two different things. The variable $scheduler contains an object of type scheduler_instance. This is different from the record that you retrieve from the database . (See model/scheduler_instance.php for the details.) scheduler_instance contains information about the scheduler, but also about the slots and booked appointments. In order to retrieve the associated database record, you can call the get_data method. E.g.: $record = $scheduler->get_data(); This will actually return a copy of what is in the $data field. It's not how I would normally use that object, though. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students can register X appointments in this scheduler

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict Students from Managing Their Own Bookings

ResponsesInList.Title: Múltiple scheduller activities
ResponsesInList.Text: I created 5 scheduller activities with the same slots- same day and hour, but for different courses. Will scheduller syncronize my appointments or these can overlap? Meaning Science year 7 student sets a 7.30 slot, will the slot be blocked to avíos clashing with my appointments from other courses?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Múltiple scheduller activities
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, Scheduler tries to avoid such clashes if they occur for teachers. (I.e. the same teacher cannot have two slots at the same time, even if these occur in different schedulers.) However, for students there is no such conflict checking. https://docs.moodle.org/35/en/Scheduler:_Conflicts Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Send Reminder group list
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I'm hoping I've just missed something rather than this being a new feature request... We've been using scheduler for a few years to manage student adviser meetings. As the student may have contact with the same adviser over several years, we don't want to strip out old scheduler meeting records, so we roll-over the same activity year to year. A few staff contacted me this week as they are prepping the start of new academic session, and report that they have a group of (say 8) students, but the Scheduler is displaying eg "4 students still need to make an appointment - send invitation - send reminder".  The staff want to send a bulk reminder out to their entire student group for the start of the new session, but only some students are listed to contact this way. Is there a simple way to reset this so that it clears the list of who needs to make an appointment so that we can prompt all students to make an appointment each semester or year? I wondered if it was because individual staff hadn't ticked students off as seen after an appointment, but as far as I was aware that only affected students making bookings if it is set to one at a time (ours can make multiple appointments). Thanks, Gordon.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Send Reminder group list
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Gordon, this indeed has to do with students being marked as "attended". I suppose your scheduler is set up to allow only one booking (or a fixed number of bookings) at a time. If a student has made a booking, they will no longer be listed as needing an invite / reminder since they can no longer make a booking. Only once they have been marked as attended, they can actually make another booking (and can be invited/reminded). One option would be that you mark past slots as attended, or delete them if they didn't take place. Another option would be to allow unlimited appointments to students. I hope this makes sense. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Upcoming slots lists past slots
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I noticed that if you've booked a slot, after the slot has already taken place, the slot is still listed under "Upcoming slots." Is there any way that old slots could be listed elsewhere, such as a tab labeled Finished slots? Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Upcoming slots lists past slots
ResponsesInList.Text: It will be listed under "finished" once the teacher has marked the student as "attended".

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: REST API For Scheduler Module

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler 3.5.0 released
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all somewhat belatedly, I have now released Scheduler 3.5.0 to the Moodle plugins DB. This is tested with Moodle 3.5 and Moodle 3.6 (release candidate). Scheduler 3.5.0 supports Moodle's new Privacy API (for GDPR compliance), including the latest changes of the API for Moodle 3.6 and 3.5.3. (It still seems a moving target.) I'm afraid that there are no other major added features in this relase. I hope to add some improvements for next May/June, time permitting. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Text:
Hello Henning, we are using moodle 3.5 and scheduler 3.3.1 our server is running a mysql database the complete error message is: Debug info: Field 'id' doesn't have a default value INSERT
INTO mdl_scheduler
(name,staffrolename,maxbookings,schedulermode,bookingrouping,guardtime,defaultslotduration,allownotifications,usenotes,usebookingform,usestudentnotes,uploadmaxfiles,requireupload,course,intro,introformat,timemodified,scale)
VALUES(?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?) [array ( 0 => 'asdfasdf', 1 => '', 2 => '1', 3 => 'oneonly', 4 => '-1', 5 => 0, Stack trace: line 489 of /lib/dml/moodle_database.php: dml_write_exception thrown line 1300 of /lib/dml/my sql i_native_moodle_database.php: call to moodle_database->query_end() line 1346 of /lib/dml/mysqli_native_moodle_database.php: call to mysqli_native_moodle_database->insert_record_raw() line 46 of /mod/scheduler/lib.php: call to mysqli_native_moodle_database->insert_record() line 124 of /course/modlib.php: call to scheduler_add_instance() line 154 of /course/modedit.php: call to add_moduleinfo()

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: dmlwriteexception while adding schedule activity
ResponsesInList.Text:
This sounds like a configuration problem of the database (schema), although I'm not quite sure why this would have changed from the default. Can you run the following query on your database? `describe mdl_scheduler id;` The expected output is: 
```text
# Field, Type, Null, Key, Default, Extra


'id', 'bigint(10)', 'NO', 'PRI', NULL, 'auto_increment'
```
 The "auto_increment" bit is what I suspect might be different in your DB.

If you create a chain of timeslots simultaneously, the only similar option is Force when overlap, which just deletes other courses running during the same time. Anyway, I realized what the main problem was. Schedule is really based on what teacher is teaching the course. As I was testing the plugin, I had the same teacher set to multiple slots in different classes.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Two questions: 1) simultaneous classtimes 2) location
ResponsesInList.Text: This is correct. Scheduler tries to prevent conflicts in the calendar of each teacher, even across different instances of Scheduler. N.B. the location field can't take formatting or hyperlinks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Restrict access to confidential notes

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Restrict access to confidential notes
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, that is the way to go. However, I think you should test it carefully to see whether that solution meets your needs - for example, by "logging in as" relevant non-editing teachers and see what they can see.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler 3.3.1 maintenance release, and Moodle 3.5 plans
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users Scheduler 3.3.1 has just been released. It doesn't contain new features, but is purely a bugfix release for Scheduler 3.3.0. It will work on Moodle 3.3, 3.4 and the upcoming 3.5. I'm planning to finish work on Scheduler 3.5 (which will support Moodle 3.5 onwards) over the next two months. This will include new features (details TBA) and in particular support for the new Privacy API . Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Feature: revoke single student
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Andriy I would not want to overload an already full teacher screen with even more buttons. Hence my initial thought was, in these cases, you could simply click the "Edit slot" button, and remove the individual student appointments that are no longer required. However, you say that this has not worked for you, giving you an error " You can't start an empty appointment slot in the past ", is that correct? This seems like a bug to me. However, I tried to reproduce it on the latest version of Scheduler, and for me everything seemed to work out fine. You can tick the " Delete this appointment (when saving the form) " checkbox for one student (or more), and the appointment will in fact be deleted. The error message is shown only when you try to delete *all* appointments in the slot, thus leaving it empty, but i understand that that's not the case you're asking about. Hence the problem might have to do with the Scheduler version you are using. The edit screen has changed several times, and the method I described above should work from Scheduler 3.3.0 on. Possibly you're using an older version - which is it? Best wishes Henning

This is however intended - if a slot starts in the past, it should not become empty. I'm also unsure how the code change you made influences the problem - I don't think that piece of code is used at the relevant point. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Show all booked slots to all students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello in order to see slots, users need to have the capability " mod/scheduler:viewslots". ( See here for further details. ) You would need to assign this capability to your users or, if necessary, to the guest user.

ResponsesInList.Title: Conflict Issues - Room Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, I am attempting to use the Scheduler as a Room Booking activity. I was looking to use a separate scheduler per room. However because I am setting the same teacher as the booking admin for all rooms this is causing conflicts with available slots. Would there be any future plans to permit removing all conflicts that would allow for the activity to be used in this manner. Or are there any simple changes that can be made to the code that would allow the same process be carried out. Many thanks, Joe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Conflict Issues - Room Booking
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Scheduler is really designed for booking appointments with teachers (not rooms), hence the conflict checks. If you would like to change this in your installation, then i think that editing the function scheduler_instance->get_conflicts(), so that it always returns an empty array, should do the trick. (This is in mod/scheduler/model/scheduler_instance.php .) I'm not sure whether this makes sense as a built-in option though. It would be quite easy to include a global option (conflict detection yes or no, for all schedulers), but is this what users want? If this is supposed to be an option on a per-scheduler basis, it becomes more tricky to implement I guess.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change teacher
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Olivia I know my reply is a little late, but let me answer for future reference. There's no feature in the interface that lets you "bulk change" the teacher in appointments. You might do this if you have someone around with the knowledge to access the database directly - here it's the table scheduler_slots and the field teacherid that needs changing. ResponsesInList.Title: Schedule appointments with non-students
ResponsesInList.Text: Is it possible to use the appointment scheduler with those in the course who are not students (non-editing teachers, managers, course creators, other teachers, etc)? What about a person who has guest access?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Schedule appointments with non-students
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Scheduler can be configured in this respect via capabilities . By default, students have the capability "mod/scheduler:appoint" (which allows them to book appointments) and teachers have the capability "mod/scheduler:manage" (which allows them to set up slots) but you could assign this to any other role. What does not work well is people having both the capabilities to set up slots and to book slots. Guests will not be able to book slots, as the slots need to be associated with a user.

I have seen such functionality developed in the Tutorship Moodle plugin but that project is no longer being maintained : https://docs.moodle.org/2x/pl/Tutorship_module https://github.com/danielneis/moodle-mod-tutorship Thanks for your help, Dan

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teachers can decide their own schedule. Students pick from a poll of Teachers
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Dan, in Scheduler, each slot is always assigned to exactly one teacher. Each teachers can set up their own slots (and choose the corresponding times) - this works just as well if you have several teachers on the course. Students can then choose one of the available slots from any teacher (unless group restrictions are in place). Different teachers might choose to offer slots at the same time, these will then be displayed to the student as separate slots (not as one slot) which they can choose from. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teachers can decide their own schedule. Students pick from a poll of Teachers

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Teachers can decide their own schedule. Students pick from a poll of Teachers

ResponsesInList.Title: Issue with Scheduler links to grading in Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning, First thanks for a very useful plugin that has been really helpful for us with booking E-Learning webinars with a global group of E-Learners. Then on to the issue we encountered which caused us some problems last week.  When updating an instance of the scheduler we found that while we made no changes to grade settings the grading disappeared. I did some tests and diagnostics which may help identify the cause. However, first it is worth noting how we use the scheduler as this may be why we have noticed this when others have not. We use a course for multiple intakes. Each course has several scheduler instances for interactive webinar booking.  We add slots for each intake. We grade students for webinar participation. The sum of webinar grades must be above a certain percentage for course completion. Recently we changed the platform used for the interactive webinars ... so we altered the description to add the new details. After this we found in some cases the grades were no longer showing. We were able to restore the grades but as part of looking into it became aware there were some perfectly reasonable actions that were causing the underlying grading problem to recur. When I looked in more detail, I discovered this is due to an issue with the user interface for editing the Scheduler text. The following sequence of actions demonstrated this: Cycle 1 Select "Edit settings" for a Scheduler instance Set Grade type as "Point" and Maximum Grade as "2" (for example) Save and display NOTE: Previously entered grades are shown as expected Cycle 2 Select "Edit settings" again NOTE: The Grade and Maximum Grade are set as expected. Set Grade Category as  "Webinars" (a category in the gradebook) Save and display NOTE: Previously entered grades are NOT shown Cycle 3 Select "Edit settings" again NOTE: The Grade and Maximum Grade are shown as NOT set. Repeat steps from Cycle 1 above … this corrects and restores the grades The way we fixed this was to use the Gradebook editor to reassert the link to the Category rather than doing this through the scheduler editing form. In this case the problem did not occur. However, it was still reproducible if we edited the grade through the Scheduler edit for the link to the Category was broken. I appears that what is happening is that when the Scheduler for is used to updated the grade category, the link to the grader item is lost. Also I notice the Ubuntu logfile shows the following error message when this incident occurs. I am not sure if this is connected. PHP Notice:  Undefined property: stdClass::$ requiremodintro in /var/www/html/moodle/course/moodleform_mod.php on line 894, referer: https://elearning.ihtsdotools.org/course/modedit.php?update=1298&return=1 Apologies for the long posting ... it would be great if this is something that can be fixed.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Scheduler links to grading in Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear David Thanks for the detailed description. I was able to reproduce the problem, but currently I'm not sure of the reason. I have put the issue on the tracker ( CONTRIB-6893 ), feel free to comment there. I'll update the entry there when the problem is resolved. The message in the logfile is likely unrelated. It points towards a global configuration setting that is not properly initialized. You can probably resolve this by navigating (as admin) to Site admininstration -> Notifications and following the screens there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Scheduler links to grading in Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: I believe this is now fixed. You can download the corrected version from github; the fix will also be included in the next maintenance release.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Issue with Scheduler links to grading in Moodle 3.2
ResponsesInList.Text: Many Thanks Henning, I am delighted to confirm that the patch to mod_form.php fixed the issue I report. Really pleased by such a quick turn-round. Thanks for your work on this really useful plugin!

ResponsesInList.Title: Seats limit overstepped in appointment slots
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, We encounter difficulties with seats limits in appointments. The Scheduler is used in a course with more than 500 students. The appointments are open at a precise hour and all students come in the course at the same time to have an appointment. In that case, seats limits are overstepped. All 45 slots have 12 seats and 2 slots have 13 participants enrolled and 2 slots have 14 participants enrolled. We made all parameters verifications : group mode is to "No Group" value, groupe appointment is to "No" and seats limit is effectively active. There is a special configuration in our infrastructure that we suspect to cause the problem : our Moodle runs on 6 load-balanced servers. Is there a verification on seats limit on booking ? Or is the seats limit only veridied on slot form load ? Thanks in advance for clarifications. Zabelle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Seats limit overstepped in appointment slots
ResponsesInList.Text: Our Moodle is a 3.1.1+ version and the scheduler module is the 2.9.1 version. Zabelle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Seats limit overstepped in appointment slots
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Zabelle There is a check at the time when the booking button is pressed. There's also an old bug that prevented this check from working ( CONTRIB-5975 ), which was present in Scheduler 2.9.0 but fixed in Scheduler 2.9.1, so if your version information is correct, then this shouldn't affect you. You may want to check the exact version number in mod/scheduler/version.php . Did you try this in a test setup, i.e., did you open two booking forms in parallel and then try to book from both of them, when the slot has only one free seat left? Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Seats limit overstepped in appointment slots
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for answer Henning. Here is are the parameters of our version.php file for scheduler module : $plugin->component = 'mod_scheduler'; // Full name of the plugin (used for diag$ $plugin->version   = 2015102902;      // The current module version (Date: YYYY$ Should our Scheduler version be affected by the bug ? Our Moodle is a production platform. We will look toward a way to make formal testing. Kisses Zabelle

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Seats limit overstepped in appointment slots
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, in your version the bug is fixed (at least the one I know of). But perhaps you've found a new bug? If you manage to reproduce the problem, let me know. Also, it would be interesting to know how much time elapsed between the last bookings on these slots. In the Moodle logs, you can find an event every time that a student makes a booking (event scheduler\booking_added). Perhaps you can find the bookings of those students that last booked into the overfull slots. Are they minutes, seconds, or maybe milliseconds apart?  (That would indicate whether it's a problem in the software, or maybe a synchronization problem in your particular setup.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler confirmation of appointment to student

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler confirmation of appointment to student
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Joost Scheduler sends notification messages on the following occasions: To teachers, when a student books or cancels an appointment, To students, when a teacher declines an appointment. (Note, no message is sent when the teacher deletes the slot instead.) See also Moodle Docs . There have been some requests to add more notification messages ( CONTRIB-4647 ), please feel to vote/comment there.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mark 'Seen' automatically
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi James No, unfortunately there is currently no such option. ResponsesInList.Title: Completion Settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Henning, Thanks for maintaining this great plugin. I have a suggestion for future versions that may be helpful for users (as well as myself of course!): In the completion settings, allowing the activity to be marked as complete when a student has made a booking, has been marked as seen etc. Thanks, Catherine

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Completion Settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Catherine, thanks for that suggestion. Actually, there is an existing feature request ( CONTRIB-4958 ) which asks for essentially this; you may want to vote/comment there. For me, the main point is that I'm not sure what exactly users would want in this respect. In our own installation, we don't use activity completion. It's not clear to me (a) how many Scheduler users would actually need this feature, and (b) what exactly would typically mean that a student has "completed" the scheduler. You name some alternatives and one could certainly come up with more, but what would actually be useful in practice? In particular, what about schedulers that allow more than one booking, that allow an unlimited number of bookings per student, etc.? If you (or anyone else in this forum) has suggestions, please do comment here or on the Moodle Tracker (ticket linked above).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Completion Settings
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Henning for your response.  I'll add to the tracker. So a scenario that I would use it for: Say I need students to book in an appointment. When a student has booked themselves in for a slot they have 'completed' the activity. This opens up quite a few possibilities e.g. It allows me to then target students who have not completed it (booked an appointment) by sending out an automated reminder email through the re-engagement plugin. Or I can send out an automated email to users who have completed it with information that they need for the meeting or class. It allows me to download a spreadsheet showing who has and hasn't completed the scheduler activity by looking at the Activity Completion report. It also allows me to restrict access to other activities on the page e.g. I don't allow students to be able to view a certain document until they have booked an appointment. Another useful completion criterion could be that the activity is 'complete' when a student has been marked as seen. Thanks, Catherine

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Slots not taken up seem to disappear?
ResponsesInList.Text: Since you're using Moodle 3.0 I guess that you have Scheduler 2.9 installed. ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Calendar event template
ResponsesInList.Text: I think the best way to achieve this would be to modify the following lines: foreach ($students as $student) { $studentnames[] = fullname($student); } Here "fullname($student)" should be replaced with: fullname($student).' ['.$student->id.']' However, you should really only modify the code if you have the experience to do so.

Thank you again for this amazing plugin and committed support. -Wasim

ResponsesInList.Title: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: Currently, Scheduler has a capability setting "mod/scheduler:disengage" which controls whether students can drop their appointments. By default, all students have this capability and they see a button "Drop my appointments" in the booking screen. However, admins can change the configuration and remove this capability from students (I'm not sure how often they do that in practice). In that case, students can't drop their appointments once they've booked a slot. They can only change their booking, dropping one appointment and booking another one at the same time. This seemed to make sense when students were only allowed to book one slot at a time. But since Scheduler 2.7, students can be allowed to make more than one booking, and then the concept of "changing the booking" is more complex (and in fact Scheduler will always allow students to drop their appointments in this configuration). With further feature requests (e.g., paging in student view, CONTRIB-5194 ), things will become even more complicated in this respect - which makes me wonder whether the feature to deny students "dropping" (rather than changing) their appointments is really worthwhile. In other words, I'm planning to remove the setting in future versions. Students would then always be allowed to drop their appointments, unless the appointments are within the "guard time". However, if you still require this feature, please reply here, and explain why you think it's required. Thanks Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: This seems like a reasonable thing to do.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: Just to say that this change has now landed in the master branch. Any student who is allowed to book a slot can now also cancel the booking, subject to time restrictions (in particular the Guard Time setting).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: A teacher has asked me how he can set up his scheduler so as to deny students cancelling a booking. I tried changing permissions in the activity for the student role, with no effect.  I Googled the problem and landed on this forum page. If I understand correctly, students can now cancel at any time, regardless of activity permissions?  Are there any workarounds to this behavior?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Marc, students can cancel their booking, regardless of permissions. However, they cannot do so "at any time". In the Scheduler settings page, you can configure a "guard time". If this is set to, say, 4 hours, then students can cancel (or change) their booking only until 4 hours before their slot begins.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Intention to remove capability "mod/scheduler:disengage"
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the reply.  Unfortunately, that option doesn't work for our needs, we want to be able to block cancellations completely .  I guess we'll have to look elsewhere.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler 2.9.0 released
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Scheduler users Scheduler 2.9.0 has now been released on the plugins DB. This release is intended for Moodle 2.9 and for the upcoming Moodle 3.0. The most important difference to previous versions in the change in group handling ( see here ). Scheduler now distinguishes between "Scheduling in groups" (i.e., a student can book their entire group into a slot), and the more standard Moodle "Group mode" ("Visible groups" etc.) The effect of setting the "group mode" is now that students can book slots only with teachers that are members of their own groups. This is a major change from Scheduler 2.7; data will be converted accordingly when you install the update, but if you have used "group scheduling" before, it may be a good idea to check your data carefully on a test system before upgrading your live system. Other changes include a much improved export feature, and a redesigned student screen. Note that Scheduler 2.7 works on Moodle 2.9 as well and you can continue to use it, but I would encourage users to upgrade to the new 2.9 branch of Scheduler (MOODLE_29_STABLE on github). We've been working with Scheduler 2.9 on our own installation for a few weeks, and it seems to be working fine; but if you find any problems, please do let me know, preferably by posting a ticket on the Moodle Tracker . Best wishes

ResponsesInList.Title: Create one schedule for multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: I have tried in vain to create one schedule in a metacourse which would show the same timeslots in the child course. The idea is that a teacher can provide their available times once, and students from multiple courses can select from this parent schedule. However, it doesn't seem to work. The Meta course does not populate other schedules in other courses. Any ideas? Thanks, Tony

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Create one schedule for multiple courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello slots are always local to the scheduler that they're created in, and the scheduler is local to the course in which it sits. Slots will not be "propagated" to other schedulers. This is due to the way that Moodle activities work. The data is always attached to a "course module", and the "course module" to a course. Anything else would badly break Moodle's core mechanisms (for example, access control or backup/restore). Instead, you may want to create a *link* from individual courses to (the scheduler in) your Metacourse.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduling conflicts
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear all Scheduler has, for a long time now, had a feature that prevents "scheduling conflicts" in some situations. In particular, teachers are warned if they are about to create a slot that overlaps with one of their other slots, in the same scheduler or elsewhere. There is no such warning for students however. Over time, I have received a number of comments regarding this feature; some were confused about how it works, and others asked for it to be changed or expanded. For the upcoming release of Scheduler 3.1, I have reviewed the "scheduling conflicts" feature, slightly altering how it behaves (with the intent of cleaning it up); and in particular, I have documented the current behavior: https://docs.moodle.org/31/en/Scheduler:_Conflicts I'd be happy to receive any comments on whether this feature is useful in the current form or should be changed. It's mostly a trade-off, I think, between being helpful to the users (through stricter consistency checks) and annoying them (by blocking them from legitimate use cases). Best wishes

ResponsesInList.Title: Deleting student slot notification
ResponsesInList.Text: Would scheduler send a notification to student if the teacher deletes his/her appointment slot? Also, when you have multi teachers, can you create repeated slots for all teachers at the same time with the same period? Or do you need to repeat it for each? Sometimes you have for example a speaking test and you have four teachers and want to create slots for all teachers at the same time. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Deleting student slot notification
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello > Would scheduler send a notification to student if the teacher deletes his/her appointment slot? No, if the teacher deletes a slot ("red cross" button), then no notification is sent. However, if the teacher cancels an appointment ("thumb down" button), then a notification is sent to the student. (For that to happen, the "Notifications" setting needs to be turned on in the relevant scheduler settings.) > Also, when you have multi teachers, can you create repeated slots for all teachers at the same time with the same period? No. You would need to repeat these steps for every teacher.

ResponsesInList.Title: New Docs for Moodle Scheduler-please review
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Everyone, I've been working with Henning on some new documentation for the Moodle Scheduler, using version 2.9 of the Scheduler. The documentation is in the attached MS Word file. Henning and I have reviewed this documentation, and now, we need others to have a look at it. We welcome any comments, questions, or suggestions--large or small. When I write documentation, I'm particularly interested in the views of people who are very new to the software, since that group is important to getting the software used more. You can send me comments in any form, by using this discussion, by downloading the MS Word file and adding comments to it, or by most other methods available. I do ask that any comments be specific. For example, if a comment says, "The section about modifying a slot confuses me," I will want to improve that section, but I won't be sure how to. If the same comment mentions some specific headings, paragraphs, or steps that are confusing, I should be able to resolve the problem. I'm looking forward to discussing the new documentation with you and improving it. Best Regards, Steven

ResponsesInList.Title: NGP in scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello I have the following problem. I am using the scheduler and students can receive a mark for their appointment, using a non graded pass scale. This, however, does not seem to work. any ideas? Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: NGP in scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello no, Scheduler doesn't currently do this (and was never designed to do so). If you set the scheduler to allow "only one appointment", then it allows exactly this - one booking per student. One option might be to switch to "one appointment at a time". Of course, then in principle every student could book another appointment once you have marked them as "seen"; I'm not sure whether that matters in your case. Another workaround is to delete the previous appointment of the student, which will allow them to book another one.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: More details of the appointment?
ResponsesInList.Text: This is not currently possible in Scheduler. A feature like that has been suggested before (see CONTRIB-5343 ) but I must say it's not on my priority list at the moment, since in our own installation we currently do not have this requirement.

ResponsesInList.Title: Copying scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello We are trying to use the scheduler tool to book laboratory sessions. For this, I have populated a scheduler with a few sessions, and would like to do multiple copies, however all copies are empty, i.e. the slots are not copied over. Any ideas?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Copying scheduler
ResponsesInList.Text: I guess you are using the "duplicate" button to create the copies. This will (whatever the activity) create a copy "without user data". For an assignment, for example, that means a copy without the user's submissions and grades. For a scheduler, it means a copy without the slots. In both cases, that's normally what you want. (Also, a copy of the slots would mean creating conflicting slots between the schedulers.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Appointments Appear in Upcoming Events Block for All Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I'm looking for some guidance/feedback on this behavior I've observed.  Scenario:  I create a Scheduler activity in Course A, and a student requests an appointment in a slot.  Then I see that appointment showing up in the "Upcoming Events" block not only within Course A, but within every other course I have: Course B, Course C, etc...  I've come to learn that the "Upcoming Events" block within a course is only supposed to show upcoming events for items within THAT course  but that doesn't seem to be the case for the Scheduler activity. Is anyone else experiencing this behavior?  Is it by design?  If not, I'm considering reporting it as a bug. Thanks Joe

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Appointments Appear in Upcoming Events Block for All Courses
ResponsesInList.Text: This is due to the design of the Moodle calendar system. In Moodle, there are four types of calendar events: Site events, course events, group events, and personal events. The Scheduler appointments need to be personal events, since they relate to individual people only, not to all participants of the course, group, etc. However, personal events cannot be filtered by course.

ResponsesInList.Title: Appointment notification emails
ResponsesInList.Text: When an appointment is made with a teacher the scheduler emails that's teacher to let them know that an appointment has been made.  Would it be possible to include the option to also notify another teacher? My scenario is this:  We have appointments that can been booked with our careers manager through scheduler and these notifications need to be sent to him, but we also need to send them to our careers administrator as she also makes appointments for him if students go to the careers office to make an appointment.  Is there any way that this can be done? Many thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Appointment notification emails
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm sorry, but Scheduler currently sends these notification e-mails only to one person: the teacher that "owns" the slot. A workaround, outside Moodle, would be if the careers manager sets up an e-mail forwarding rule, filtering e.g. on the subject of the e-mail, that forwards the notifications to the administrator. This would clearly depend on your e-mail system/client, but e.g. in Gmail it would work, I think.

ResponsesInList.Title: Overlapping time slots for a teacher in 2 courses

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Overlapping time slots for a teacher in 2 courses
ResponsesInList.Text: This is correct - Scheduler will prevent teachers from setting up such conflicting slots. Otherwise, teachers might end up with two bookings by two different students at the same time.

ResponsesInList.Title: How to extend flexibility?
ResponsesInList.Text: Students working part-time in addition to studying or having little children need different options to make appointments with their teacher. The challenge is to keep the organisation simple. It is a big advantage for teachers to schedule all appointments with their students in one single tool. Being asked for a teacher might make an appointment with a student that was not offered in one of the regular slots. Here the "volatile slots" would come in handy. The teacher could add a single slot for the appointment and reserve it for the student. Without setting it to be cancelled after being released the slot could be registered by other students. "Volatile slots" also come with the option to automatically send a reminder and with the option to cancel an appointment. Another nice to have feature would be the possibility to offer more slots but set the number of possible appointments per day/week/month to a maximum (n slots : m appointments, n > m). What do you think? Regards Peter

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: How to extend flexibility?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Peter I'm sorry, the "volatile slots" are now gone for good - and in fact, since I proposed to remove them a year and a half ago, you're the first person to ask for them. I think that few people have ever made use of them (as far as they worked in the first place). From my personal experience in using Scheduler, there's a limit to the "one single tool" approach. There are always some special cases where I need to communicate directly by e-mail with students to make an appointment, or where I know that they need not/should not sign up for an appointment; for example, if students are ill, on a leave of absence, can't make any of the slots I offer for various reasons... I think these will always exist, and Scheduler cannot cater for all these special cases. I usually set up an appointment for these student in Scheduler once I've fixed the details with them by e-mail. Regarding more flexibility in how many appointments a student can book, that's an interesting idea; something related has been proposed before ( CONTRIB-5267 ). Feel free to add your views there, or to open a new feature request on the Tracker. I must say though that I'm not planning to implement this with priority; I'm not even sure what solution here would be best for most users. Best wishes Henning

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Require appointment only for students in certain group
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Unfortunately, Scheduler 2.7 (which you are probably using) does not work seamlessly with the recently introduced group restrictions. (It was designed to work with the "Group members only" feature, which was removed in Moodle 2.8). This will change in Scheduler 2.9, where group restrictions should work as expected. Scheduler 2.9 will require Moodle 2.9 and I work towards a release in September. Meanwhile, you're welcome to use it on a test installation (use the master branch on github) but it's not quite ready for production use yet.

ResponsesInList.Title: Students see can make appointments for Teachers not in their group
ResponsesInList.Text:
Moodle version: Moodle 2.8.5+ (Build: 20150313) Version 2014111005.01 and Scheduler version: 2014090100 2.7.0

We have a course with Group Mode = Separate Groups and Force Group Mode = Yes. There are multiple teachers for the course and a group is created for each teacher containing the teacher themselves and their assigned students. A student will only be assigned to one teacher.

There is one scheduler in the course and we are relying on Moodle grouping to prevent teachers and students from seeing slots and appointments outside of their group.

The problem is students are seeing every slot for every teacher and can schedule an appointment with any teacher even if the teacher is not the one in the group they are assigned to.

Can you describe how we can set up the scheduler so that they a student only sees the slots for the teacher in their group?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students see can make appointments for Teachers not in their group
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I have exactly the same issue ! Suggestions welcome

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Students see can make appointments for Teachers not in their group
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Currently, i.e., up to and including the current stable version (branch MOODLE_27_STABLE), Scheduler does not have any feature for restricting students to book only within their groups. Rather, the "Visible groups" / "Separate groups" setting is used to enable *booking in groups*; i.e., with group mode enabled, students can make an appointment for their entire group at the same time. ("Visible groups" and  "Separate groups" actually behave identically.) However, for the next release (Scheduler 2.9, I expect a release in early September), this behaviour will change, and it will allow to restrict students to appointments with teachers in their groups. For details see here: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=316797 The feature is available on the master branch on github and you're welcome to test it, but I would not recommend it for production use yet.

ResponsesInList.Title: Feature change: Group mode
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello a rather major change in the way that Scheduler handles groups has just reached the master branch. (This isn't ready for production use yet, but tests/feedback are welcome. It will be part of an upcoming 2.9 relase.) In previous versions, when you set the "Group mode" of the activity to either "Visible groups" or "Separate groups", then students were able to book into slots one group at a time. This was a bit out of line with how other parts of Moodle handle group mode , where it's more like an access restriction. Now, Scheduler has two group related features which are clearly separated. Group scheduling: This means that students can make a booking for their entire group, similar to earlier versions. The feature can be switched on or off at a per-activity level, using the new "Booking in groups" setting. Group mode: The "Visible groups" / "Separate groups" setting will now mean that the activity is "split in groups" in the usual Moodle sense: students can book a slot only with a teacher who is a member of the same group. Teachers who don't have the privilege to "access all groups" will also see a restricted set of slots only. The configuration settings will be migrated during upgrade; that is, if before upgrade you had a scheduler in "Visible groups" mode, then after upgrade it will have "Booking in groups" set to "yes" and its group mode set to "none". Please check your data after migration.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler message: No appointment required, or all the announced appointments are complete.
ResponsesInList.Text: I have set up 2 Schedulers (for different school Years) and they have the exact same configuration. One of them is working and the other one when I test it with a student account I get the following message: No appointment required, or all the announced appointments are complete. And I am not able to see or book slots. Can some kind hearted person point me to where the problem might be? Thank you!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler message: No appointment required, or all the announced appointments are complete.
ResponsesInList.Text: This would normally mean that no slots are available to the student. Either no slots have been set up, or they aren't available (e.g. their "available from" date is in the future). It is also possible that the student is allowed to book only one appointment, and has already done so. A screenshot of the student screen and the teacher screen would help to isolate the problem.

ResponsesInList.Title: Scheduler overview allows view of grades between unrelated courses
ResponsesInList.Text: My institution has a widespread requirement for a good slot booking plugin in Moodle, and I have been evaluating Scheduler as a potential solution. I have set up the following scenario, and the results raise concerns for us about leakage of students' grades between courses: Create Course A with users Student A and Teacher A. Create Scheduler A in Course A and enable grading. Teacher A books a slot with Student A, marks the student as seen and gives the student a grade. Also create Course B, but with users Student A, Teacher A and Teacher B. Create Scheduler B in Course B. Login as Teacher B (who is not enrolled in Course A). Go to the Scheduler Overview tab and filter the view by Teacher A. Teacher B is now able to see the grade given to the student by Teacher A, in a course that Teacher B is not enrolled on and cannot enter. I would be interested in knowing whether others who are using Scheduler view this as a feature or a bug. Are there any workarounds to prevent this happening? I know that we can downgrade the Teacher role capabilities to those of a Non-editing Teacher, but this leaves Teachers unable to book slots for other Teachers. Any comments or suggestions would be very welcome.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Scheduler overview allows view of grades between unrelated courses
ResponsesInList.Text: Dear Erica yes, that's right: The "Overview" tab allows teachers to see data from other courses. That might seem a little unintuitive, since Moodle's "coursemodule instances" are normally completely isolated from each other, and access rights are maintained on the level of individual "coursemodules" (eg, Schedulers). However, to my understanding it's a feature, and one that has been in Scheduler for a very long time (back to Moodle 1.9, before I took over the maintenance of Scheduler). I haven't changed it since. I'm actually not so sure how useful the "Overview" feature, looking across all schedulers and courses, actually is. For what I'm concerned (or our institution), we could just restrict the data to the current scheduler or course.
